siteMetadata.title: rantum.dev
siteMetadata.subtitle: digital dwelling of andrew maury. digital developer @ecomloop in burlingame, ca. san matean nantucketer on a rantum scoot.

frontmatter.title: Expected outputs
frontmatter.description: Recognize the expected outputs from a given effort. Don't expect results that don't match the inputs.

frontmatter.title: Make things, better
frontmatter.description: When change happens quickly, it's a chance to build new things. Use this chance to make things, better this time.

frontmatter.title: Finding good in the challenge
frontmatter.description: Find the good aspects that won't come back. Recognize the challenge is the only way forward.

frontmatter.title: Set the right targets
frontmatter.description: Hitting targets every time may be a sign of not setting big enough goals.  It's better to miss the right target than consistently hit easy targets.

frontmatter.title: Push ideas out
frontmatter.description: Keep pushing out new ideas. Brainstorm on a single topic and create a list of ideas to get influenced creatively. Let the ideas spill over to other areas to keep moving forward.

frontmatter.title: Short term bursts
frontmatter.description: Sometimes it takes short term bursts to get mometum going, especially when the goal feels far away. Push through, find energy, keep going.

frontmatter.title: Develop a better reality
frontmatter.description: Reality doesn't just happen to us. Many aspects are not controllable in the near term. Adjustments can be made to create and develop a better reality, rather than succumbing to setbacks.

frontmatter.title: Small improvements
frontmatter.description: Small improvements, however small, are better than regression. Gains are constantly compounded Making up for negative progress is much more difficult than steady progress through small improvements.

frontmatter.title: Spinning wheels in the sand
frontmatter.description: Find ways to be more effective with time and avoid simply spinning tires in the sand. Take a better approach rather than digging too far.

frontmatter.title: Incremental gains
frontmatter.description: Big gains feel unlikely in the current environment. String together small incremental gains for happiness and effectiveness. Incremental gains eventually lead to step change.
